etymology.description: 电(electricity) + 荷(load; burden) = electric charge.
etymology.interpretation: Conceptualizes charge as a load borne by electricity, with 荷 echoing terms like 负荷. A modern technical calque, likely influenced by Japanese 電荷.
etymology.simplification: 电 was simplified from 電 in character simplification (PRC); 荷 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 电子带负电荷(電子帶負電荷)。
examples.english: An electron carries a negative charge.

examples.chinese: 质子带正电荷(質子帶正電荷)。
examples.english: A proton carries a positive charge.

examples.chinese: 导体上的电荷会移动(導體上的電荷會移動)。
examples.pinyin: Dǎotǐ shàng de diànhè huì yídòng.
examples.english: The charge on a conductor will move.
